members.docComment:
/**
 * Assert that a condition remains true for the whole timeout.
 *
 * @param testfunc - The test function. Must return `true` to signal success.
 *
 * @param __namedParameters - Options (currently not visible in output due to typedoc bug)
 *
 * @param message - Error message shown if the testfunc fails.
 *
 * @param timeout - How long to wait, in milliseconds.
 *
 * @param checkEvery - Intervals between checks, in milliseconds.
 */
members.name: assertAlways

members.docComment:
/**
 * Assert that an asynchronously evaluated condition is eventually true.
 *
 * @param testfunc - The async test function. Must return `true` to signal success.
 *
 * @param __namedParameters - Options (currently not visible in output due to typedoc bug)
 *
 * @param message - Error message shown if the condition never becomes true within the timeout.
 *
 * @param timeout - How long to wait, in milliseconds.
 *
 * @param checkEvery - Intervals between checks, in milliseconds.
 *
 * @param crashOnError - `true` (default): A thrown error/exception is an immediate failure. `false`: A thrown error/exception is treated as if the test function returned false.
 */
members.name: assertAsyncEventually

members.docComment:
/**
 * Assert that a condition is eventually true.
 *
 * @param testfunc - The test function. Must return `true` to signal success.
 *
 * @param __namedParameters - Options (currently not visible in output due to typedoc bug)
 *
 * @param message - Error message shown if the condition never becomes true within the timeout.
 *
 * @param timeout - How long to wait, in milliseconds.
 *
 * @param checkEvery - Intervals between checks, in milliseconds.
 *
 * @param crashOnError - `true` (default): A thrown error/exception is an immediate failure. `false`: A thrown error/exception is treated as if the test function returned false.
 *
 * @example
 * ```javascript
 * let called = false;
 * setTimeout(() => {called = true;}, 2000);
 * await assertEventually(() => called);
 * ```
 *
 */
members.name: assertEventually

/**
 * Assert that an HTTP response finished with the given status code.
 *
 * @param response - HTTP fetch response object, as gotten from `await `[["net_utils".fetch|`netutils.fetch`]]`(...)`, or the promise resolving to that (e.g. just `[["net_utils".fetch|`netutils.fetch`]]`(...)`).
 *
 * @param expectedStatus - The expected HTTP status (e.g. 201 for Created)
 *
 * @param __namedParameters - Options (currently not visible in output due to typedoc bug)
 *
 * @param message - Error message shown if the assertion fails.
 *
 * @returns {*} The fetch response object.
 *
 * @example
 * ```javascript
 * const response = await fetch(config, 'https://foo.example/');
 * await assertHttpStatus(response, 200);
 * // Or, the shorter form:
 * const shortResponse = await assertHttpStatus(fetch(config, 'https://foo.example/'));
 * ```
 *
 */
members.name: assertHttpStatus

/**

 * const emailPromise = catchLater(getMail(...));
 * await ...
 * const email = await emailPromise;
 * ```

/**
 * Click any element by its text content.
 *
 * The text can span multiple nodes compared to `clickText` which matches direct descended text nodes only.
 *

 *
 * @param textOrRegExp - Text or regex to match the text that the element must contain.
 *
 * @param __namedParameters - Options (currently not visible in output due to typedoc bug)
 *
 * @param timeout - How long to wait, in milliseconds.
 *
 * @param checkEvery - Intervals between checks, in milliseconds. (default: 200ms)
 *
 * @param extraMessage - Optional error message shown if the element is not visible in time.
 *
 * @param visible - Optional check if element is visible (default: true)
 *
 * @param assertSuccess - Deprecated: Alias of retryUntil
 *
 * @param retryUntil - Additional check to verify that the operation was successful. This is needed in cases where a DOM node is present and we clicked on it, but the framework that rendered the node didn't set up any event listeners yet.
 */

/**
 * Mark a code section as expected to fail. If the async function throws an error, the error will be included in reports, but not counted as a test failure. If the async function succeeds, a warning will be printed.
 *
 * @param config - The pentf configuration.
 *
 * @param message - Error message to show when the section fails (recommended: ticket URL)
 *
 * @param asyncFunc - The asynchronous section which is part of the test.
 *
 * @param __namedParameters - Options (currently not visible in output due to typedoc bug)
 *
 * @param expectNothing - Do nothing  this is convenient if the code is expected to work on some environments. (default: false)
 *
 * @example
 * ```
 * await expectedToFail(config, 'BUG-1234', async() => {
 *     ...
 * }, {
 *     expectNothing: config.env === 'very-good-environment',
 * });
 * ```
 *
 */
members.name: expectedToFail
extraMessage

members.docComment:
/**
 * fetch a URL. Apart from the first parameter, this implements the [Fetch API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API). (Using this method rather than another enables outputting of curl commands with `-c` and a couple of defaults suitable for pentf).
 *
 * @param config - The pentf configuration object.
 *
 * @param url - URL to fetch.
 *
 * @param init - fetch options, see [`RequestInit` in the Fetch Spec](https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#requestinit). On top of the standard Fetch parameters, we support the following nonstandard parameters: - `agent`: node [HTTP/HTTPS agent](https://nodejs.org/api/https.html#https_class_https_agent) - `curl_include_headers`: boolean (default false) of whether to include `-k` in the curl output. - `curl_extra_options`: List of extra options for the curl output. - `cookieJar`: A [CookieJar object](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/blob/master/README.md#cookiejar) to use. Pass in the string `'create'` to create a new one (returned as `response.cookieJar`). The response will have a utility function `async getCookieValue(name)` to quickly retrieve a cookie value from the jar.
 *
 * @example
 * ```javascript
 * const response = await fetch(config, 'https://example.org/json-api', {
 *     method: 'POST',
 *     headers: {
 *         'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 *     },
 *     body: JSON.stringify({
 *         key: 'value',
 *     }),
 * });
 * assert.strictEqual(response.status, 200);
 * const data = await response.json();
 * ```
 *
 */
members.name: fetch_2

/** * Retrieve and delete an email. * * @param config - The pentf configuration object. * * @param since - Earliest time the email can be sent. (To avoid finding the email of a prior test.) * * @param to - receiveer email address (`config.email` if you have just one email address, often the result of `makeRandomEmail`) * * @param subjectContains - Search string for the subject. * * @param wait_times - How long to wait between checking email. By default, we wait about 3 minutes total. * * @returns {Object} Email object with `html` and `text` properties. * * @example * ```javascript * const email = makeRandomEmail(config, 'myTestCase'); * const start = new Date(); * await ... // register with email * const welcomeMail = await getMail(config, start, email, 'Welcome'); * assert.strictEqual(welcomeMail.text.includes('Hello')); * assert.strictEqual(welcomeMail.html.includes('

Hello')); * ``` * */

/**
 * Launch a new browser with puppeteer, with a new page (=Tab). The browser is completely isolated from any other calls. Most interactions will be with the page, but you can get the browser using `await page.browser();`. For more information about the page object, see the [puppeteer API documentation](https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/master/docs/api.md).
 *
 * @param config - The pentf configuration object.
 *
 * @param chrome_args - Additional arguments for Chrome (optional).
 *
 * @returns The puppeteer page handle.
 *
 * @example
 * ```javascript
 * const page = await newPage(config);
 * await page.goto('https://example.org/');
 * await waitForText(page, 'More information');
 * await closePage(page);
 * ```
 *
 */
members.name: newPage

members.docComment:
/**
 * Modify fetch options for a request authenticated with a client-side TLS certificate.
 *
 * @param fetchOptions - The fetch request option object to modify. (`init` parameter in [[fetch]] above)
 *
 * @param keyFilename - Name of the private key file in PEM format (e.g. beginning with `-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----`)
 *
 * @param certFilename - Name of the certificate file in PEM format (beginning with `-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----`)
 *
 * @param rejectUnauthorized - to validate the server's certificate, false (=default) to accept invalid certificates as well.
 *
 * @example
 * ```javascript
 * const init = {method: 'POST', body: '{"something": "secret"}'};
 * await setupTLSClientAuth(init, 'key.pem', 'cert.crt');
 * const response = await fetch(config, 'https://protected.example.org/', init);
 * assert.equal(response.status, 200); // 401 = invalid certificate
 * ```
 *
 */
members.name: setupTLSClientAuth

/**
